stream_access_rules.Yellowstone Park Fishing Permit: Required for all anglers 16+. No state licenses accepted.
stream_access_rules.Catch & Release: Native species (cutthroat, grayling, whitefish) must be released immediately.
stream_access_rules.Open Season: Last Saturday in May through October 31
Restricted Areas: Lamar Drainage: Mandatory kill of non-native trout

fishing_itineraries.title: Classic Yellowstone Trout Loop
days: Day 1: Madison River (upper section near Madison Junction); evening hatch action
Day 2: Firehole River (near Midway Geyser Basin); rich hatches and warm waters
Day 3: Gibbon River (below Gibbon Falls); mix of browns and rainbows

fishing_itineraries.title: Spring Creek Explorer
days: Day 1: Nez Perce Creek for solitude and brook trout
Day 2: Upper Gibbon Meadows with terrestrials
Day 3: Madison near 7-Mile Bridge for late evening spinner falls

fishing_itineraries.title: Fall Big Browns Circuit
days: Day 1: Madison River near Baker’s Hole for brown trout run
Day 2: Yellowstone River below Fishing Bridge

fishing_itineraries.title: Beginner-Friendly Intro Loop
days: Day 1: Casting lesson and gear check at Big Sky Anglers
Day 2: Half-day guide trip on Firehole River
Day 3: Self-guided on the Gibbon River picnic area stretch

fishing_itineraries.title: Backcountry Challenge
days: Day 1: Hike to Grebe Lake (grayling fishery)
Day 2: Backpack and camp near Slough Creek 2nd Meadow
Day 3: Morning fishing before hiking out
